question: Which territory houses the "Salvation's Islands"?
explanation: Salvation's Islands are a group of three small volcanic islands located off the coast of French Guiana, an overseas region of France, in the Atlantic Ocean. These three islands are Devil's Island, Royale Island and Saint-Joseph Island. Of these three islands, Devil's Island is the most famous because of the location of a political prison of the 19thÂ  and 20th-century and housed notorious penal colony for the worst criminals of France.
